captions.text:
Vasily Buslai - N.Okhlopkov
Gavrilo Oleksich - A.Abrikosov

Leader of Teutonic Knights V.Ershov.
Tverdilo - S.Blinnikov

WITH ITS GREAT LAND
AND WEALTH.

THE GERMAN PLUNDERERS EXPECTED
AN EASY VICTORY OVER OUR PEOPLE

RUS' HAD JUST ENDURED THE
BLOODY BLOW OF THE MONGOLS

TRACES OF THE CRUEL CONFLICT
WERE VISIBLE EVERYWHERE

The was a great feat
on Neva River.

On Neva River,
in the great water.
We beat back an evil force

We broke our ships
in pieces

Stop shouting?
You're scaring the fish!

Don't fight
in your host's house!
We'll make boats and trade overseas.

You could join us
and be a great warrior

We'll never leave
Our Russian land.

Those who attack us
Will be beaten.

it'd be hard
to beat them.

It's time to avenge
our fathers.

There's a more dangerous
and evil enemy closer by

Once we beat them we
can take on the Mongols.
It's all the same to us

Vasily Buslaich! Gavrilo Alekseich!
Have pity on an old friend.

Who needs it? You probably
made them last night.
We all get by as we can.

We're through fighting, it's
time to think of other things.

Young blood's getting
restless, spring's in the air.

We've earned glory fighting,
time to think about ourselves.

He's getting ready to marry,
have you heard?

A billy-goat looking
for a nanny-goat.

One day fighting,
two days of boredom.

To go out on
the Volga with an axe!

- Feel sad now.
- You should become a monk.

If my courting
doesn't work out,

Like sending a bull
to a china-shop.

Olga Danilovna, when can I send
matchmakers to your father?

Olga Danilovna, tell us,
who should send matchmakers?

I'm sorry. I don't know
what you're talking about.

What do you mean?
Don't pull our legs!

if you want a big,
jolly fellow, pick me.

If you want someone reasonable
and boring, pick him.

If you want
to be beaten, pick him.

If you want
to be a housewife, me.
I don't know what to say.

Give me time,
and I'll tell you.

The Germans have taken
Pskov and are heading here!

They kill anyone
who raises a sword

against them,
they kill even for bread.

They tear mothers and wives
from sons and husbands.

They kill you for crying
out or keeping silence.

They're parcelling out Russia:
one gets Pskov, another Novgorod.

So they took Pskov!
We can buy our way out!

The ships are ready,
the coffers full.

You'd sell out Russia
for goods?

Every man for himself,
home is where the hearth is.

To the rich, it's all the same:
mother, mother-in-law,

home is where
the profit is.

But us poor are the ones
the Germans will kill.

We need to act
quickly ourselves.

Master, Pskov
is at your feet.

That's not how
you take a town!
If you take Novgorod this way

Great Master,
allow us more rope.

- Rope? What for?
- To tie up Novgorodians.

The one who
defeated the Swedes.

The people who can
defeat us haven't been born.

There is one God
in heaven,

that shines more
brightly on some.

Only one Catholic Lord
rules the earth.

I won't be
like you, Tverdilo!

- I'm with you, father!
- Leave while you can, Vasilisa!

Burn everything. Wipe them
off the face of the earth!

Go to Pereyaslavl
and get Nevsky!

Dead Pskov calls
to you, Alexander!

We should be fighting Germans,
not fixing nets.

Prince, some people
from Novgorod have arrived!

The people of Novgorod
ask that you be their prince.
No one to break it up?

Have pity on us
forget any old offenses.

- That's right, come to defend us.
- Defend you?

Your men are a match
for the Germans.

and they'll be gone
by spring!

Stand up for
your father's home

- Go home!
- We don't like you here!

Like it or not,
I've come as a warrior.

- Great Novgorod!
- If you don't share your wealth,

There are Mongols
from the Volga to Novgorod.

You're all that's left,
Great Novgorod!

Rise up for the Fatherland!
For the Motherland!

For our fields,
forests and rivers!

- We'll make five hundred shields!
- A thousand!

- I'll give five hundred axes!
- A thousand!

We'll risk our heads,
Lead us, Prince!

Take everything I've got!
Take it all!

Take it!
Death to the enemy!

Tell us, Olga,
we're leaving tomorrow!

Don't keep us waiting!
Tell us!

Whoever's braver can
send for the matchmakers.

Without armor
you won't hurt a fly!

King Alexander
dares to confront us

His vanguard is trapped
in the woods like a bear.

I invite you to hunt
the Russian bear.

- You show them the way.
- All right.

So this hare runs
through the ravine

into the forest
with the fox on his tail.

I think I'll take
your maidenhood.

don't shame me! No time
for pity, says the hare,

Run, Prince! Save yourself!
Lead your troops home!

They've killed Domash
and taken Buslai.

We'll meet their cavalry here,
by Raven Rock.

The ice is thin, Prince,
it could suddenly break.

Germans wear heavier armor!
It'll break under their weight!

Not enough space
to face the enemy?
It'd be better on our side.
Lead us to the other side, Prince!

let's get over to our side
before getting cut off.

It's easier to fight
on our own turf,

If you haven't the strength
to fight on the foreign side,

I won't let those dogs
touch Russian soil!

We'll put the head
infantry at Raven Rock.

Gavrilo, you take
the left flank.

and you, Mikula,
lead the support troops.
The main attack will hit here.

- And who takes the main attack?
- You do.

You ran all night,
now stand our ground

Hold them off until Gavrilo
and I hit from the sides.
as a barrier in the rear.

- It'll be easier to hold them off.
- Good idea!

- Remember our pledge to Olga.
- You too.

What are we talking for?
Let's get moving!

When the Germans hit,
give them time to get wedged in.

Then we'll strike
from both sides!

Make it hot for them,
Novgorodians!

All right men,
let's hit the Germans!

The strength isn't
in the forge

A clever man
can trick a witch!
Won't die by the sword now!

- Where are the Germans?
- There are no Germans!
There are no Germans, my dears!!
We didn't shed blood in vain!

What're you saying?
You'll die before the wedding?
He was the bravest in battle,

All this bickering, no one
takes matters in hand!

if you'd bought time
dealing with the enemy!

Remember the battle, and tell your
children!

you'll be a second Judas
to the Russian land.

I mean it: if enemies come,
I'll raise all Russia -

and if you stand aside,
I'll beat you unmercifully!
If I die - my children will!

Untie them,
they were forced to fight.

As for him
what should we do?

I told them it's
not the color of their hair

but who is
bravest in battle!

My Vaska
is second to none!

They won't let
us live or die in peace!

for the first time
in my life.

neither I nor Gavrilo
should be the bridegroom.

- courage of all!
- So be it!

You've shamed me!
I wanted to have a wedding!

You... Why couldn't
you be first!

Take as daughter-in-law
that one, in the armor!

You keep you fists
to yourself at home!

Go and tell everyone
abroad that Russia lives,

and that anyone
can visit her without fear!

But he who comes with
a sword, dies by the sword!

On this Russia stands,
and will forever!
HE WHO COMES WITH A SWORD

comments.text:
Alexander Nevskij and its Director Sergei Eisenstein was a major influemce 
on the work of Akura Kurasawa in his epic Seven Samuri which is one of my 
favorite films. I did see Mr Eisenstein's use of montage fast editing and 
his use of humour. I was struch by the depiction of the religious figures 
and some of the scenes were schocking as to the depiction of the killing of 
babies and children. This film shows much of the history of Russia and the 
experience of battle and is a must see.﻿

comments.text:
Alexander Nevsky (Олександръ Ярославичь, Russian: Алекса́ндр Яросла́вич 
Не́вский, Aleksandr Yaroslavich Nevskiy; pronounced [ɐlʲɪˈksandr 
jɪrɐˈslavʲɪtɕ ˈnʲefskʲɪj] ( listen); 30 May 1220*disputed 1230 – 14 
November 1263, proclaimed Saint of the Russian Orthodox Church by 
Metropolite Macarius in 1547[1]) was the Prince of Novgorod, Grand Prince 
of Kiev and Grand Prince of Vladimir during some of the most trying times 
in the country's history. Commonly regarded as the key figure of medieval 
Rus', Alexander was the grandson of Vsevolod the Big Nest and rose to 
legendary status on account of his military victories over the German and 
Swedish invaders while agreeing to pay tribute to the powerful Golden Horde.

Alexander Nevsky (Russian: Алекса́ндр Не́вский) is a 1938 historical drama 
film directed by Sergei Eisenstein. It depicts the attempted invasion of 
Novgorod in the 13th century by the Teutonic Knights of the Holy Roman 
Empire and their defeat by Prince Alexander, known popularly as Alexander 
Nevsky (1220–1263).
Eisenstein made the film in association with Dmitri Vasilyev and with a 
script co-written with Pyotr Pavlenko; they were assigned to ensure that 
Eisenstein did not stray into "formalism" and to facilitate shooting on a 
reasonable timetable. It was produced by Goskino via the Mosfilm production 
unit, with Nikolai Cherkasov in the title role and a musical score by 
Sergei Prokofiev, Alexander Nevsky was the first and most popular of 
Eisenstein's three sound films. In 1941 Eisenstein, Pavlenko, Cherkasov and 
Abrikosov were awarded the Stalin Prize for the film.
In 1978 the film was included in the world's 100 best motion pictures 
according to the opinion poll conducted by the Italian publishing house "A. 
Mondadori".[1]﻿
comments.author: Leon Coray

comments.text:
Старый фильм молодой Александр Невский стал героем после ледового побоище 
но дальше он был предателем, так как он все-таки поехал в орду стал 
приемным сыном Хана Батыя и подавил анти-монгольское восстание. Как плохо 
что наши уже давно не умеют нормально снимать кино, я бы хотел увидеть

comments.author: hans müller

comments.text:
Stalin's agreement?? Western propaganda makes it sound like this agreement 
was the cause of German intervention into Soviet Union....idiotic illogical 
and politicized point of view fed from birth to all westerners who don't 
have their own opinion on anything, let alone know historic facts. Stalin 
agreed to this pact to delay the beginning of the inevitable war with 
Germany, because Soviet Union was not ready for it. Western propaganda 
tries to stay quiet about the following facts....

1. There could be no friendship between Germany and USSR, whose political 
systems were absolute ideological enemies.

2. Stalin desperately asked the west for alliance against Germany prior to 
the Molotov pact, but all western nations refused, leaving Stalin alone and 
with no other choice but to sign the non-aggression pact with Hitler (again 
Soviet Union desperately needed at least one or two more years to finish 
industrialization and prepare for war).

3. The pact also split Poland between Germany and USSR, which pushed the 
Russian boundary away from major Russian cities, proving to be vital during 
the war. West tries to portray this as horrible occupation of Poland, but 
they fail to mention that Stalin took exactly as much land from Poland as 
belonged to Russia by the "Curzon Line" which was recognized as Soviet 
territory anyway by all western countries after WWI, in fact this boundary 
line was put in place by the council of western countries themselves, not 
Russia.

4. Ever heard of the Munich Agreement? Agreement signed by the western 
nations with Hitler long before the Molotov pact, which basically gave the 
poor Czechoslovakia to Germany to annex. One of the most immoral pacts in 
human history, which west conveniently keeps quiet about...

To finish this up, unlike the west, Soviet Union honored all of its ally 
duties during the war. Britain and other soviet allies on the other hand, 
hoped for Soviet union and Germany to destroy each other. Despite being 
allies, Britain and US refused to open second front in Europe to help 
Stalin until the very end of war when it was no longer needed to USSR, and 
did so only because they were afraid that USSR is going to claim the 
victory all for itself, which would be a just thing to do, because 89% of 
German armed forces perished on the Eastern front. More of that Britain and 
US, kept captured German formations armed instead of disbanding them, in 
the hope of using them in their planned attack on soviet union after the 
war, which is supported by numerous historical documents available to 
anyone who is interested in learning history, rather than getting their 
information from the Television.

comments.author: Anikin navij

comments.text:
I looked up the history of the film this morning, as my sister was 
listening to Prokoviev's brilliant concert cantata - Alexander Nevsky - and 
we learned it was made in 1938.  The Teutonic Knights were sporting 
swastikas in deference to the Nazi threat building to the west and 
Prokoviev wrote much of the music both before and while watching scenes 
from the film.  Stalin had a private viewing without Eisenstein present and 
had some reels of film 'cut' as they did not express the correct 
'political' statement.  No one knows where those reels have disappeared to. 
 I love Eisenstein's films.  'October 1917' and "Strike' and 'Potemkin' 
plus Ivan the Terrible being favourites.﻿

comments.text:
Milyona - you. Us - darkness, both darkness, and darkness.
Try, battle to us!
Yes, Scythians - we! Yes, Asians - we,
With slanting and greedy eyes!

For you - an eyelid, for us - uniform hour.
We, as obedient lackeys,
Held a board between two hostile races
Mongols and Europe!

Centuries, eyelid your old horn forged
Also I muffled a thunder, an avalanche,
And the failure was the wild fairy tale for you
Both Lisbon, and Messina!

You hundreds years looked to the east
Saving and melting our pearls,
And you, mocking, considered only term,
When to set muzzle guns!

Here - term came. Krylami is beaten by trouble,
And every day offenses multiplies,
And day will come - there will be no trace also
From yours Pestumov, perhaps!

Oh, old world! While you weren't lost,
While you pine for a flour sweet,
Stop, wise, as Oedipus,
Before the Sphinx with an ancient riddle!

Russia - Sphinx. Exulting and grieving,
And being covered with black blood,
She looks, looks, looks in you
Both with hatred, and with love! ...

Yes, so to love as our blood loves,
None of you don't love long ago!

You forgot that in the world there is a love,
Which burns down, and ruins!

We love everything - and heat cold числ,
And gift of divine images,
To us distinctly all - and sharp Gallic sense,
And gloomy German genius...

We remember everything - the Parisian streets a hell,
And venetsyansky cool,
Lemon groves far aroma,
And Cologne smoky bulks...

We love a flesh - both its taste, and color,
And stuffy, mortal I began to smell fleshes...
We if your skeleton will crackle are guilty
In heavy, our gentle paws?

We got used, sufficing by the bridle
Playing horses zealous,
To break to horses heavy sacrums,
And to pacify slaves obstinate...

Come to us! For horrors of war
Come to peace embraces!
While the getting is good - an old sword in a sheath,
Companions! We will become - brothers!

And if isn't present - we have nothing to lose,
And perfidy is available to us!
Centuries, eyelid you will damn
Sick late posterity!

We it is wide on a jungle and the woods
In front of Europe nice
We will part! We will turn back to you
The Asian ugly face!

Go everything, go on the Urals!
We clear a place to fight
Steel cars where the integral breathes,
With the Mongolian wild horde!

But we - from now on to you not a board,
From now on we won't engage,
We will have a look as mortal fight is humming,
The narrow eyes.

We won't move, when the furious Hun
In the pockets of corpses will feel,
To burn down the cities, and to drive herd to church,
And to fry meat of white brothers! ...

Last time - come round, the old world!
On a brotherly feast of work and the world,
Last time on a light brotherly feast
The barbarous lira calls!
comments.author: Андрей Власов

And gift of divine images,
To us distinctly all - and sharp Gallic sense,
And gloomy German genius...

We remember everything - the Parisian streets a hell,
And venetsyansky cool,
Lemon groves far aroma,
And Cologne smoky bulks...

We love a flesh - both its taste, and color,
And stuffy, mortal I began to smell fleshes...
We if your skeleton will crackle are guilty
In heavy, our gentle paws?

We got used, sufficing by the bridle
Playing horses zealous,
To break to horses heavy sacrums,
And to pacify slaves obstinate...

Come to us! For horrors of war
Come to peace embraces!
While the getting is good - an old sword in a sheath,
Companions! We will become - brothers!

And if isn't present - we have nothing to lose,
And perfidy is available to us!
Centuries, eyelid you will damn
Sick late posterity!

We it is wide on a jungle and the woods
In front of Europe nice
We will part! We will turn back to you
The Asian ugly face!

Go everything, go on the Urals!
We clear a place to fight
Steel cars where the integral breathes,
With the Mongolian wild horde!

But we - from now on to you not a board,
From now on we won't engage,
We will have a look as mortal fight is humming,
The narrow eyes.

We won't move, when the furious Hun
In the pockets of corpses will feel,
To burn down the cities, and to drive herd to church,
And to fry meat of white brothers! ...

Last time - come round, the old world!
On a brotherly feast of work and the world,
Last time on a light brotherly feast
The barbarous lira calls!
comments.author: Андрей Власов

comments.text:
Александр Невский...1932 г .
Этот фильм знаменит фразой, которую его создатели вложили в уста Александра 
Невского: «А если кто с мечом к нам войдет — от меча и погибнет. На том 
стояла, и стоять будет земля русская!». История борьбы великого 
князя-полководца с тевтонскими рыцарями и великой победы в Ледовом побоище. 
Фильм снимался по социальному заказу в преддверии грядущей войны с 
фашистской Германией. Однако сразу после выхода картины в прокат, был 
подписан знаменитый пакт о ненападении, и все копии картины были изъяты из 
кинотеатров. Зритель вновь увидел фильм лишь в 1941 году, когда пакт о 
ненападении был нарушен

- Сталинская премия I степени С.Эйзенштейну, Н.Черкасову, А.Абрикосову, П. 
Павленко. (1941)
- Премия за режиссуру на XIV МКФ в Каннах (Франция). (1941)﻿
comments.author: Красная Правда

comments.text:
Alexandre Nevky de Sergei Eisenstein musique Serge Prokofief.
Le film retrace un événement phare de l'histoire russe au XIIIe siècle : 
l'opposition d'Alexandre Nevski à l'invasion du pays par les chevaliers 
teutoniques La bataille sur lac Peïpous pris par les glaces est 
remarquable. Prokofief nous fait entendre avec l'oreille d'un russe l'orgue 
des chevalier teutoniques. À l'heure où menace les fascismes la lutte 
vaillamment menée et la victoire obtenue brillamment par le jeune prince 
contre les teutons au XIIIe siècle prend une valeur d'idéal patriotique.﻿
comments.author: rachid mohand mestiri

comments.text:
Больше всего поражает колоссальное количество народа, задействованное на 
съемке! И то, как сумели передать атмосферу и события, как в конце треснул 
лед, и славяне прям как наподбор настоящие, суровые бородатые лица в 
доспехах того времени. Не то что сейчас у нас снимают фильмы про войну с 
огромным бюджетом, где армия состоит из 10 человек. Ещё бы побольше 
реалистичности в смертях правда можно было бы сделать, а то видно что 
дерутся и протыкают друг друга не по настоящему, но это даже не портит

comments.text:
невежа, Русь пошла от варяг, а Невский был князем от Рюрика, потом - прямой 
потомок варяг. Русью назывались тогда не все славяне, а только воинское 
сословие - княжьи дружины. А варяги - суть славяне, только западной ветви - 
прибалтийские. Так что прежде чем нести ахинею, хотя бы потрудились хоть 
что-то изучить по теме.

comments.text:
Мне одной смешно как девчонка мечом орудует? И зачем она ему оглоблю кинула 
вместо меча? С сцена битвы не затянута? Про "коротка кольчужка" не совсем 
понятно: ведь удар пришелся именно в кольчугу старичку. Бедняга погиб под 
непонятную развеселенькую музычку, зато когда стали тонуть тевтонцы, она 
сменилась на жутковатую. Где логика? Вообще ура-патриотизм и исторические 
сюжеты мне не чужды, но не пойму, что именно в этом фильме гениального. 
По-моему всё скорее тяп-ляп, чем шедевр.
comments.author: irka19851
